meanings.definition: A member of the working class.
meanings.sent1: The proletarian worked hard in the factory.
meanings.sent2: The city was full of proletarians going to their jobs.
meanings.sent3: The proletarian decided to take a break and enjoy a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of suits, she stood out like a proletarian in a boardroom.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tired, determined proletarian stuck in his mind.

meanings.sent1: The proletarian movement aimed to improve working conditions.
meanings.sent2: She wore a proletarian outfit to show solidarity with the workers.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a proletarian charm with its simple decoration.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a proletarian strength that resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The old, worn-out boots had a proletarian authenticity to them.
